subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (ap-southeast-1)

messages.content:
Subject: Critical issue: Critical api issue in search-api (ap-southeast-1)

Automated detection from monitoring system:

The search-api service in the ap-southeast-1 region is experiencing critical service unavailability, specifically affecting the /api/v1/auth/login endpoint. This issue is indicated by a 503 status code, suggesting backend service overload or dependency failure. All users attempting to authenticate are impacted, preventing access to the application and potentially leading to user dissatisfaction and loss.

Service: search-api
Region: ap-southeast-1
Severity: critical
Event Type: api

Metrics:
{
  "latency_ms": 794.05,
  "status_code": 503,
  "request_size_kb": 43.56
}

Workaround: Currently, there is no workaround available. It is recommended to investigate the health of backend services and dependencies for the search-api. Scaling resources may be necessary, and reviewing logs for errors related to the 503 status code is advised.

This ticket was auto-generated by the AI monitoring system.

current_triage.rationale: The ticket describes a critical service unavailability affecting all users, which aligns with a P0 urgency classification.

current_routing.reasoning: Routed to engineering due to outage classification. SLA set based on enterprise tier and P0 priority. Escalated due to P0 critical priority.
